==Naming==

In Egypt and also the wider Arab world, the protests and subsequent changes in the government, are mostly called the '''25 January Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© 25 ÙÙØ§ÙØ±}} ''Thawrat 25 YanÄyir'') and '''Rage Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØºØ¶Ø¨}}),and sometimes called <ref>{{cite news|journal=[[Al-Ahram]] Weekly|title=The 25 January Revolution (Special issue)|date=10â16 February 2011|url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/2011/1034/special.htm|accessdate=15 February 2011}}</ref> the '''Revolution of the Youth''' ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ´Ø¨Ø§Ø¨}} ''Thawrat al-ShabÄb''), '''[[Nelumbo|Lotus]] Revolution'''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.cnn.com/2011-01-28/world/egypt.press.club_1_saad-eddin-ibrahim-egyptian-american-egyptian-people?_s=PM:WORLD |title=Egyptian-American leaders call for U.S. support of 'Lotus Revolution' - CNN |publisher=Articles.cnn.com |date=2011-01-28 |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref> ({{lang|ar|Ø«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙÙÙØªØ³}}) or the '''White Revolution''' ({{lang|ar|Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ±Ø© Ø§ÙØ¨ÙØ¶Ø§Ø¡}} ''al-Thawrah al-bayá¸ÄÊ¾'')<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.gulf-daily-news.com/NewsDetails.aspx?storyid=299386 |title=Business News Â» Investors See White Revolution In Egypt |publisher=Gulf Daily News |date=2011-02-13 |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref>. In the Media it has been known as the "'''18 Day Revolution'''"<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.shapeshift.net/2011/02/egypts-remarkable-18-day-revolution/ |title=Egyptâs Remarkable 18 Day Revolution |publisher=Shapeshift.net |date= |accessdate=2011-03-21}}</ref>.
